ENTRY.SYNOPSIS: Save grouping flags to a FITS table or ASCII file

DESC.PARA: The save_grouping command saves the array of grouping flags associated with a data set to a column in a FITS table file or column-based ASCII file, by data set id. An array element set to 1 marks the beginning of a group and an element set to -1 marks subsequent members of that group.

LIST.ITEM: id - the id of the data set to which the group array has been assigned; if not given, uses the default data set id (id=1 by default, see "ahelp get_default_id")
bkd_id - the id of the background data set to use (e.g., bkg_id=1 represents the first background data set loaded in association with the source data set specified in the 'id' argument)
ascii - outfile format specification; True to save outfile in ASCII format, False for FITS, default=False
clobber - clobber outfile; default=False (do not clobber if file exists)

DESC.PARA: The save_grouping function can be called with just a filename, in which case all the default arguments will be used. In this example, the grouping scheme associated with data set id=1 is written to the FITS table file 'group.fits'.

Here, the optional 'ascii' argument is set to True in order to produce an outfile in ASCII format (overriding the default setting ascii=False). The grouping scheme assigned to data set id=2 is written to the text file 'group.txt'.
The group array associated with the first background data set loaded for source data set 2 is written to FITS file group_bkg.fits (note the 'ascii' parameter default is False).
